noun.description: A long-tailed crow with boldly marked (or green) plumage and a raucous voice.
Used in similes or comparisons to refer to a person who collects things, especially things of little use or value, or a person who chatters idly.
examples: his father was a garrulous old man who chattered like a magpie
he would carry these documents home to appease his secretive magpie instinct

origin: Late 16th century: probably shortening of dialect maggot the pie, maggoty-pie, from Magot ( Middle English pet form of the given name Marguerite) + pie.
